oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from E. R. Porter to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing "amid thousands upon thousands of soldiers," Porter described marching from Corinth "expecting every moment to see the Elephant." Although he came near to a skirmish, his company was too late to be involved, and saw artillery companies retreating to get out of range of Federal gun boats. A post script inquired about rumors that "some of the negroes had ranaway."
